    Update Your InformationUADepartmentsCurrent page:  University Development
                                        
    		About University Development
    	Ways to GiveChico State Fund and Calling CenterScholarships and AwardsChico State Student Philanthropy CouncilThank You LettersSupporting the Chico ExperienceThanks to the generosity of alumni, parents, and friends, Chico State changes lives every day through real-world learning, applied research, and a commitment to community and service.University Development generates philanthropic support to enhance the Chico Experience. Our team of professional development officers, along with our amazing students at the Chico State Calling Center and Student Philanthropy Council, work across the University to build resources forscholarships;academic and student development programs;faculty research and recruitment;programs and services that benefit the North State;improved campus facilities and technology; andinitiatives that keep us leading the way in sustainability, study abroad, student experience, and community engagement.Get InvolvedConnect with our development officers to support colleges, athletics, North State Public Radio, and other campus programs.Join the Tower Society(opens in new window) and invest in Chico State's future by making a leadership gift today.Talk with one of our Chico State Calling Center students next time they call. (If your phone isn't ringing, update your contact information.)Learn how students are building a culture of philanthropy through the Student Philanthropy Council.Keep college affordable for deserving students; establish a scholarship.Give NowMake a gift online today or learn more about giving to Chico State. Please review our Gift Policy.University AdvancementVice President Ahmad BouraKendall Hall, Room 114530-898-3590www.csuchico.edu/advancementSupport Chico StateDepartmentsAdvancement ServicesAlumni & Parent EngagementUniversity CommunicationsUniversity DevelopmentUniversity Public EngagementChico Performances(opens in new window)
We acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus. We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.Contact UsNeed Help?FacebookFacebookTwitterTwitterInstagramInstagramReport an accessibility issueReport a broken link on this pageTitle IXPrivacy PolicyCalifornia State University, Chico400 West First StreetChico, CA 95929Copyright © 2023 All Rights Reserved
